results.title: James Galway Program 8
results.brief_description: James Galway introduces a small orchestra performance of Saint Saens “Carnival of the Animals” to which William Rushton reads verses by Jeremy Nicholas. Orchestra: Andrew Ball, Julian Jacobson, Piano; Paul Barrit, Leader; Mayum Seilor, Violin; Tim Boulton, Viola; Timothy Hugh, Cello; Chi-Chi Nwanoku, Bass; Philippa Davies, Flute; E Johnson, Clarinet; Evelyn Glennie; Percussion. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 7
results.brief_description: James Galway introduces saxophone quartet, “The Fairer Sax” (Anne Louise Lane, Gabrielle Lane, Karen Street and Julia Mills), to perform “Arrival of the Queen of Sheba” by Handel, “Andante and Scherzo” by Bozza, “Air on a G String” by Bach, “Rondo Cappiccioso” by Mendelsohn,

results.title: James Galway Program 6
results.brief_description: James Galway introduces the Kings Singers to sing “O Lusty May” (Scots 16C) “Woe worth the time” (Scots 16C), “There’s Nae Luck” (trad), “O Waly” (trad - cello accompaniment Timothy Hughs), “Sea Runes” by M Davies, “The Bee by Bridge”, “The Flight of the Bumble Bee” by Rimsky Korsakov, “Creole Love Call” by Duke Ellington. Rated G

results.title: James Galway Program 5
results.brief_description: James Galway introduces the cellist Julian Lloyd Webber, with Peter Pettinger on piano to perform “Arioso in G” by Bach, “Schezzetto” by Bridge, “Elegaic” by Faure, “Gavotte No 2” by Popper, “In the Holy Light” by W Lloyd Webber, and “Ritual Fire Dance” by Manuel de Falla. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 4
results.brief_description: Siner, Maureen Braithwaite is introduced by James Galway, flautist, and joined by percussionist, Evelyn Glennie and clarinettist, Emma Johnson, to perform “Danse Macabre” (sung) by Saint Saens, “Sonata Finale” by Poulenc, “Donde Leiter” from “La Boheme” by Puccini, “Study on Black Keys” by Chopin, “Jeannie with the Light Brown Hair”, “Tambourin Chinois” by Kriesler, “Summertime” by Gershwin. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 3
results.brief_description: Famous flautist, James Galway, introduces Nigel Kennedy, the violin virtuoso, with Peter Pettinger on piano to perform “Notta” by Manuel de Falla, 1st movement of a sonata by Ravel, Gershwin’s “2nd Prelude”, Gershwin’s “1st Prelude” and finally “Alls Blues” by Miles Davis. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 2
results.brief_description: In this program James Galway, famous flautist introduces John Lill, the pianist to perform as soloist “The Chaconne” by Bach, “Nocturne in E Minor, Opus 72” by Chopin and the “Finale of the 7th Sonata” by Prokofiev. Rated: G

results.title: James Galway Program 1
results.brief_description: James Galway, famous flautist, is accompanied by pianist Philip Moll, to perform “Sonata 1st Movement” by Poulenc, a “Fantasie” by Faure, “Schon Rosmarin” by Kriesler, “Carmen Fantasy” arranged by Borne based on the work of Bizet. Rated: G

results.title: James Dean: the rare movies
results.creator_credit: Justis Addiss, Don Medford, William Self, Mort Abrahams, Martin Horrell, Meridan and Management Corporation of America
results.brief_description: These three teleplays, produced in 1953, 1954 and 1955 display James Dean’s mastery of playing the young angst-ridden loner who longs for a better life for himself. “Something for an empty briefcase”: A young drifter and ex-jailbird pines to be a respectable gentleman in life, the type who carries a briefcase to work, instead of a thief. One night he meets a young dancer who displays to him that it is possible to live with passion for life, not just for money. “The unlighted road”: Jeffrey is an ex-army serviceman drifting from small town to small town hoping to find a connection somewhere or with something. One night he is offered a job in a diner but suspects foul play amidst some of the more seedy customers. When Jeffrey falls for a local girl, their future together is threatened by his boss’ dodgy dealings. “I’m a fool”: an older man laments his youthful folly when as a simple farm boy he put on false airs and graces in order to win the attention of the lovely and sophisticated Lucy. Also stars: Natalie Wood. All three short films retain the advertisements from the show’s sponsor inserted at intermission.
